quote_first: After a moment reality reasserted itself, and she realized she hadn’t been hallucinating, but dreaming. The clock on the desk read 12:55. They’d begun their ten-minute session at
quote_last: , so obviously she had twenty minutes to account for.
title: The Enclave
author: Karen Hancock

quote_last: , the host of the show emerged from a heated tent to massive applause from the crowd. She was dressed in a fuchsia coat, with a black turtleneck, a knee-length skirt, black tights, and knee-high boots.
title: The First Phone Call From Heaven
author: Mitch Albom

quote_first: He rolled one way, rolled the other, listened to the loud tick of the clock, and was asleep a minute later.
quote_last: in the morning. Fifty-one hours to go.
title: 61 Hours
author: Lee Child
